subject: Re: [junit] Strange request: examples of "beautiful" test code
msgSnippet: ... Yup, another good side of annotations.  That and the fact that they can contain attributes, which can t easily be expressed with the prefix hack:
messageBody:
On 11/29/06, Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:
>
> Cédric,
>
> Following up on what you said, I see "test" as a form of meta-data, but
> since it is only there by convention the compiler can't help you if you
> spell "tset" instead. Annotations are native meta-data so the IDE can help
> more.


Yup, another good side of annotations. That and the fact that they can
contain attributes, which can't easily be expressed with the prefix hack:
@Test(threadPoolSize = 10, invocationCount = 100).

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
